title: EastEnders' Katie Jarvis is proud to 'stand up for hard-working people'
text:
EastEnders star Katie Jarvis has spoken about how the support of her fellow actors has given her the strength to ‘stand up for hard-working people’.

Katie — who portrayed Hayley Slater in the BBC One soap — was job-shamed earlier this month for supporting her children with a security job at B&M Bargains.

However, the coverage resulted in several actors — from soap, television and film — taking to social media to show their support for Katie, commending her while listing all the jobs they’ve done in between acting roles in order to provide for both themselves and their family.

Speaking to Grazia magazine about the outpouring support she received — including support from actors Aaron Sidwell and Bronagh Waugh— Katie said: ‘Their support gave me the strength to speak out and stand up for hard-working people – especially single mums. As long as I’m providing for them, nothing else matters. Everything I do is for them.”

Katie appeared on the Victoria Derbyshire show earlier this month, where she also discussed the support she’s received, saying: ‘I am overwhelmed by it, I didn’t realise. I’m not on Twitter so didn’t see any of it. It’s kept me away from the bad stuff but to hear that was amazing – I am so glad to have their support.’

Katie played Hayley Slater in EastEnders last year, and featured in a number of storylines — her biggest undoubtedly being the secret fling she’d had off-screen with Alfie Moon (Shane Richie), which led to a showdown with Kat (Jessie Wallace) on Christmas day. The character made her final appearance in February this year.
